channel.title: Compile error
channel.description:
Hello when i try to compile my server i get this error[code]'"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe"' is not recognized as an inte rnal or external command, operable program or batch file. Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
[/code] And when i compile my client i get this error [code]You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. Go to Mod Taharok's tutorial on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for a direct link to download the newest JDK Update. Press any key to continue . . .
[/code] Wich i have got the latest version of java... Also runnin my server works fine.... and runnin my client works fine its just the compilin im stuck on atm... Help me please Thanks

item.title: Compile error
item.dc:creator: @str_rockstar str rockstar
item.description:
@str_rockstar wrote:

lol, download jdk 6 u10… chnage the jre to jdk in variables, and change it to 6u10 and use this compiler

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Kalvin, post:5, topic:252016”]i god jre6 update 7 and my envirounmental varibales are The class path is “CLASSPATH=C:\Program files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;”
And the path is “C:\Program files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin;”[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 22, 2008, 10:01:33 am[/size][hr]Add me on msn please it will be quuicker… lool my addy is showerface123@hotmail.co.uk[/quote]

Change the jre in them to jdk.

item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

[quote=“Kalvin, post:3, topic:252016”]When i use that compiler i get this error “‘javac’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .”[/quote]
What JDK do you have, and have you set your environmental variables?

item.title: Compile error
item.dc:creator: @masta_XY masta XY
item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

Use this compiler it has no direct JDK to use, it will use any installed.

[code]@title Compiler
@echo off

javac -source 1.5 -target 1.5 -classpath . *.java -g

pause[/code]

Read full topic
